TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ClaimsIdentity extends System.Object implements class System.Security.Principal.IIdentity

Docs.summary: Represents a claims-based identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ClaimsIdentity class is a concrete implementation of a claims-based identity; that is, an identity described by a collection of claims. A claim is a statement about an entity made by an issuer that describes a property, right, or some other quality of that entity. Such an entity is said to be the subject of the claim. A claim is represented by the <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim> class. The claims contained in a ClaimsIdentity describe the entity that the corresponding identity represents, and can be used to make authorization and authentication decisions. A claims-based access model has many advantages over more traditional access models that rely exclusively on roles. For example, claims can provide much richer information about the identity they represent and can be evaluated for authorization or authentication in a far more specific manner.
Beginning with .NET Framework 4.5, Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) and claims-based identity have been fully integrated into the .NET Framework. This means that many classes that represent an identity in the .NET Framework now derive from ClaimsIdentity and describe their properties through a collection of claims. This is different from previous versions of the .NET Framework, in which, these classes implemented the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity> interface directly. The collection of claims that describe the identity can be accessed through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> property. The ClaimsIdentity class provides several methods for finding and modifying claims and fully supports language integrated queries (LINQ). In application code, ClaimsIdentity objects are typically accessed through <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal> objects; for example, the principal returned by <xref:System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal> class has a <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.Claims%2A> property as well. In the majority of cases you should access the user’s claims through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.Claims%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection rather than through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection. You will need to access the claims of an individual ClaimsIdentity only in the cases where the principal contains more than one ClaimsIdentity and you need to evaluate or modify a specific identity.
> [!IMPORTANT] > To add or remove claims from the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection, a caller must have full trust.
In the claims-based model, the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property and the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal.IsInRole%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> method are implemented by evaluating the claims contained by an identity. The base implementations in the claims-based model are provided by the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.IsInRole%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. The <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A> properties enable you to specify a claim type that should be used to evaluate the claims contained by the identity when performing these operations.
Delegation scenarios are supported through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an empty claims collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|A empty collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType>.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType>.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|Initialized from the `claims` parameter.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType>.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType>.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Actor` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|The value of the `identity.AuthenticationType` (<xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) property is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.BootStrapContext` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the claims from `identity` are added to the new instance; otherwise, an empty collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Label` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|If `identity` is not assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, is not `null`, and has an <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property that is not `null`; a name claim is added to the new instance using the value of the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. **Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.NameClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType> is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.RoleClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType> is used.|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Actor` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|The `authenticationType` parameter. If the `authenticationType` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the value of the `identity.AuthenticationType` (<xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) property is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.BootStrapContext` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|Initialized from the `claims` parameter. If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the claims from `identity` are added to the new instance before those specified by the `claims` parameter.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Label` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|If `identity` is not assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, is not `null`, and has an <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property that is not `null`; a name claim is added to the new instance using the value of the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. **Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.NameClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType> is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.RoleClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType> is used.|

## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|The value of the `authenticationType` parameter. If the `authenticationType` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the property is set to `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|An empty collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|The value of the `nameType` parameter. If the `nameType` parameter is null or an empty string, the property is set to <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType>.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|The value of the `roleType` parameter. If the `roleType` parameter is null or an empty string, the property is set to <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType>.|

## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> class.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Actor%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Actor` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A>|The `authenticationType` parameter. If the `authenticationType` parameter is `null` or an empty string, the value of the `identity.AuthenticationType` (<xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) property is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.BootStrapContext` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A>|Initialized from the `claims` parameter. If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the claims from `identity` are added to the new instance before those specified by the `claims` parameter.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A>|**Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.IsAuthenticated%2A> property is returned based on the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Label%2A>|If `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.Label` property; otherwise, `null`.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A>|If `identity` is not assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, is not `null`, and has an <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property that is not `null`; a name claim is added to the new instance using the value of the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity.Name%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. **Note:** When accessed, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property is returned based on the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> and the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A>|The value of the `nameType` parameter. However, if the value of the `nameType` parameter is `null` or an empty string and `identity` is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.NameClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultNameClaimType> is used.| |<xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.RoleClaimType%2A>|The value of the `roleClaimType` parameter. However, if the value of the `roleClaimType` parameter is `null` or an empty string and identity is assignable from <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>, the value of the `identity.RoleClaimType` property is used; otherwise, <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.DefaultRoleClaimType> is used.|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the identity of the calling party that was granted delegation rights.
Docs.value: The calling party that was granted delegation rights.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An application can access the delegation chain that led to the current call, by recursively examining the Actor property. The token on whose behalf the call is being delegated can be accessed through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.BootstrapContext%2A> property.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set the property to the current instance occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddClaim(class System.Security.Claims.Claim claim) cil managed

Docs.param: The claim to add.
Docs.summary: Adds a single claim to this claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The claim is examined and if the subject is different than this claims identity, the <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.Clone%28System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is invoked with this claims identity as the parameter to create a new claim with the correct subject.
This method has the `SecurityCritical` attribute applied to control which entities can add claims to the identity. Further down the pipe, authorization decisions are made based on the claims that are present in the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddClaims(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Security.Claims.Claim> claims) cil managed

Docs.param: The claims to add.
Docs.summary: Adds a list of claims to this claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each claim is examined and if the subject is different than this claims identity, the <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.Clone%28System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is invoked with this claims identity as the parameter to create a new claim with the correct subject.
This method has the `SecurityCritical` attribute applied to control which entities can add claims to the identity. Further down the pipe, authorization decisions are made based on the claims that are present in the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Gets the authentication type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically one of the values defined by the <xref:System.Security.Claims.AuthenticationTypes> class.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the token that was used to create this claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The underlying object is an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.BootstrapContext?displayProperty=fullName> class.
Set the `saveBootstrapContext` attribute on either the [\<identityConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CidentityConfiguration%3E.md) or the [\<securityTokenHandlerConfiguration\>](../Topic/%3CsecurityTokenHandlerConfiguration%3E.md) element in a configuration file to specify whether the token used to generate the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> should be preserved in the BootstrapContext property.
If the BootstrapContext property is not `null`, applications can access the original token and the claims it produced through the properties and methods of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.BootstrapContext?displayProperty=fullName> class.

Docs.permission: Set operation requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be set by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Gets the claims associated with this claims identity.
Docs.value: The collection of claims associated with this claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection may contain entries that are `null`.
The claims contained in the Claims collection essentially describe the entity that is represented by the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity>. The claims describe the properties and rights possessed by the entity and can be examined by applications to make decisions about authentication and authorization.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal> class has a <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.Claims%2A> property as well. In the majority of cases you should access the user’s claims through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.Claims%2A?displayProperty=fullName> collection rather than through the Claims collection. You will need to access the claims of an individual <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> only in the cases where the principal contains more than one <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> and you need to evaluate or modify a specific identity.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HasClaim (string type, string value);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HasClaim(string type, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the claim to match.
The value of the claim to match.
Docs.summary: Determines whether this claims identity has a claim with the specified claim type and value.
Docs.returns: if a match is found; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Does not check the <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.Issuer%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.OriginalIssuer%2A> properties. The comparison is made using Ordinal, case sensitive on value; case in-sensitive on type.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the identity has been authenticated.
Docs.value: if the identity has been authenticated; otherwise, **false**.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `true` if the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.AuthenticationType%2A> property is not `null` or an empty string.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the label for this claims identity.
Gets the name of this claims identity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns the value of the first claim with a type that matches the name claim type set in the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.NameClaimType%2A> property. If no claim is found that matches the name claim type, returns `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets the claim type that is used to determine which claims provide the value for the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property of this claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The NameClaimType property specifies the claim type (<xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.Type%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) that is used to provide the name for this identity. The name is accessed through the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Name%2A> property.
This property is set by the constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveClaim(class System.Security.Claims.Claim claim) cil managed

Docs.param: The claim to remove.
Docs.summary: Attempts to remove a claim from the claims identity.

remarks.format:
## Remarks It is possible that the claim cannot be removed because it is not owned by the identity. For example, this would be the case for role claims that are owned by the principal. Unlike the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.TryRemoveClaim%2A> method, which returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the claim has been removed, RemoveClaim throws an exception if the claim could not be removed
The specified claim is matched by object reference (<xref:System.Object.ReferenceEquals%2A>).
This method has the `SecurityCritical` attribute applied to control which entities can remove claims from the identity. Further down the pipe, authorization decisions are made based on the claims that are present in the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Gets the claim type that will be interpreted as a .NET Framework role among the claims in this claims identity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The role claim type is the claim type (<xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim.Type%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) that is used when evaluating this identity for the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.IsInRole%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> method. The <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal.IsInRole%28System.String%29?displayProperty=fullName> method is called to determine whether the current principal is in a specified role. The claims-based model extends this check to use claims presented by the principal. A <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal> object can contain one or more <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> objects and each identity object can contain multiple <xref:System.Security.Claims.Claim> objects. The RoleClaimType property specifies the claim type of the claim that should be used to provide the value for the role when evaluating this <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity> object. The property is set by the constructor. A common value is <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimTypes.Role?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool TryRemoveClaim(class System.Security.Claims.Claim claim) cil managed

Docs.param: The claim to remove.
Docs.summary: Attempts to remove a claim from the claims identity.
Docs.returns: if the claim was successfully removed; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks It is possible that the claim cannot be removed because it is not owned by the identity. For example, this would be the case for role claims that are owned by the principal.
The specified claim is matched by object reference (<xref:System.Object.ReferenceEquals%2A>).
This method has the `SecurityCritical` attribute applied to control which entities can remove claims from the identity. Further down the pipe, authorization decisions are made based on the claims that are present in the <xref:System.Security.Claims.ClaimsIdentity.Claims%2A> collection.

Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.
